intro: Eumachia monopedicellata, commonly known as the single-fruited eumachia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Eumachia monopedicellata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
